events.comment: If device doesn't have a touch screen, delete objects in the "OnScreenButtons" group.
Setting variables that are used for the direction of movement, if keys or buttons are pressed.

If one of those direction variables are changed, create a marker object on the player.
Then, using a "while" event type, check if the marker object is on a an object from the group named "objects".
When the marker has finished moving, check to see if it's in collision with a wall or not. And then if a box ends the turn on top of a Goal object.
Reset direction variables to 0 to prevent the above events from triggering again without the player pressing a key.
Change the scene to the current scene to reset the level.
If all goal objects have their animation changed to "filled", show the WinGame layer.
